item.title: 玫瑰是红的，紫罗兰是蓝的。当橘皮测试结束时，他还会爱我吗？

Violets are blue.
Will he still love me

item.title: 十年前，在比弗利伍德花二三十万美元就能买到一栋房子。现在呢？"你不可能以低于300万美元的价格买到任何一条黄金街道上的地皮"。
item.description:
A decade ago, you could buy a house in Beverlywood for $200,000 to $300,000. Now? “You can’t buy just land on any of the prime streets for less than $3 million.” https://t.co/RBxihsTvsu https://t.co/RBxihsTvsu

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 纽约州西部一个自称是汉堡包发源地的小镇正在酝酿一项计划：在空中放一个巨型汉堡来吸引游客它将 "成为我们的象征"。
item.description:
A plan is cooking in a Western New York town that claims to be the birthplace of the hamburger: Put a giant burger in the sky to attract tourists. It would “be a symbol of who we are.” https://t.co/K1FOHlwHgZ https://t.co/K1FOHlwHgZ

item.title: "穿袜子睡觉简直是变态行为"越来越流行的睡眠建议 让夫妻和朋友们产生了分歧"你把你的脚关进了监狱"
item.description:

item.title: "人们意识到，不住在洛杉矶或纽约也没关系"。亚特兰大大都会区长期以来一直是嘻哈艺术家、音乐家和职业运动员的聚集地，如今已成为电影和电视行业的圣地。

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：SAT 考试是在揭示当前能力的差异，而不是制造这些差异。@jasonrileywsj 写道，取消考试并不会让这些差异消失。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The SAT is revealing differences in current ability, not creating those differences. And scrapping the tests wouldn’t make those differences disappear, writes @jasonrileywsj.https://t.co/1iME1Ojn8L

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 当局称，一名涉嫌在费城郊区枪杀三人的男子已将自己困在新泽西州的一栋住宅中
item.description:
A man suspected of fatally shooting three people in suburban Philadelphia has barricaded himself in a New Jersey home, authorities said https://t.co/DCIMxDAR3D https://t.co/DCIMxDAR3D

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：联邦政府向州和地方政府提供的资金超过了其国防开支。这是一个和平时期福利国家的优先事项，而不是一个在充满敌人的世界里认真保卫自己的国家的优先事项。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The federal government gives more cash to state and local governments than it spends on its own defense. These are the priorities of a peacetime welfare state, not a nation serious about defending itself in a world of enemies. https://t.co/IJFuHkdmRA

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：拜登政府是时候认清现实了：绝大多数巴勒斯坦人支持谋杀犹太人，而以色列人认为巴勒斯坦人不配拥有一个国家，@amitsegal22 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: It’s time the Biden Administration recognizes reality: The Palestinians overwhelmingly support the murder of Jews, and the Israelis don’t think the Palestinians deserve a state, writes @amitsegal22 https://t.co/MZz9LpgW7b

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：TikTok 动员其约 1.7 亿美国用户大军游说国会，反对要求出售 TikTok 的法案。这一噱头可能适得其反。
item.description:

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024

item.title: 租车意味着每天花费高达 80 或 100 美元（如果你能找到一辆车的话）的日子一去不复返了。"这是旅行中为数不多的能让消费者真正享受到价格优惠的领域之一"。
item.description:
Gone are the days where renting a car meant spending upward of $80 or $100 a day—if you could even find a car. “It's one of the few areas in travel where there's actually a little bit of price relief for the consumer.” https://t.co/tPwc93Qgg2 https://t.co/tPwc93Qgg2

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 16, 2024
